summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York daily lieutenant's log for August 10, 2019. It records the routine operations of the facility and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital while CPR was in progress.

persons.name: Felix
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 85775-054 listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion at the beginning of the shift.

persons.name: Williams
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 78640-054 listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion.

persons.name: Gentile
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 171230-054 listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion.

persons.name: Ramos
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 85428-054 listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 186824-054 (later corrected to 86824-054) listed as being in a dry cell under restraint and accompaniment by staff.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 76318-054 who was found unresponsive in his cell (206-220) in Unit 9 South, prompting a medical emergency. CPR was performed and he was transported to a local hospital via ambulance.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in cell 206-220, Unit 9 South. He was found unresponsive and CPR was initiated. An EMS ambulance arrived, and he was transported to a local hospital at 7:10 AM with CPR still in progress.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is the official prison log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died.
At 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (registration #76318-054) was found unresponsive in cell 206-220 in Unit 9 South.
CPR was performed on Epstein at the scene and continued by EMTs. He was transported via ambulance to a local hospital at 7:10 AM with CPR still ongoing.
The log records several other inmates on psychological observation (Felix, Williams, Gentile, Ramos) and one inmate (Fernandez) in a dry cell under restraint.
The ending count for the facility shows Epstein was no longer in the facility count, listed under 'Local Hosp: 00', indicating he had been transported out.
